section.title: What are fragments in OSGi?
section.para: A fragment is an optional attachment to another plug-in. This other plug-in is called the host plug-in . At runtime the fragment is merged with its host plug-in and for the runtime both projects are just one. Fragments are always optional for their host plug-in and the host plug-in doesn't even know that it exists.

The Eclipse IDE supports the creation of fragments via fragment projects . To create a fragment project select
File New Other... Plug-in Development Fragment Project
.
